title: Drawing, "Designs for two frames", 1780
medium: Pen and black ink, traces of graphite, brush and wash on white laid paper
inscribed: Inscribed in ink, lower center: Cartelle
creditline: Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council
description: Horizontal rectangle showing two circular mirror frames, or plaques. Left: urn at top, cornucopia with flowers at either side from which are suspended garlands. Right: rollwork terminating in a volute at top, decorated with a flower garland and leaves. Black frame lines.

tombstone.epitaph:
Drawing, "Designs for two frames", 1780.
1780. Pen and black ink, traces of graphite, brush and wash on white laid paper. Purchased for the Museum by the Advisory Council. 1911-28-182.
